page.title: 14SUPERNATURAL
page.content: One very famous ghost is often seen in Dibden churchyard. It is the ghost of Lady Alice Lyle who was executed by the notorious Judge Jeffries. She hid two young men who had escaped from the Battle of Sedgemoor. The two men were later found sheltering in a ditch. Although Lady Alice lived in Ringwood, she often came to stay on her son's estate and regularly attended services at Dibden Church. She was executed in Winchester. It is interesting to note that the two young men were also executed. Another haunting in the area is a horseman dressed in black riding very quickly along an old Roman road. Voices are often heard in Beaulieu Abbey. They sing old fashioned chants in the Abbey Chapel. An old lady and gentleman dressed in Victorian clothes are seen walking back and forth across the road.
